camera_to_lcd.c

00012 //POB-Eye include
00013 #include <pob-eye.h> 
00014 
00015 
00016 int main (void)
00017 {
00018         // Value declaration and initialization
00019         Int16 i=0,j=0,k=0,i_Cam=0,i_LCD=0;
00020 
00021         //LCD buffer, 128*64 pixels, 1 byte per pixel
00022         UInt8 LCD_Buffer [LCD_WIDTH*LCD_HEIGHT*BYTES];
00023         
00024         // Graphic buffer
00025         GraphicBuffer LCD_Screen; 
00026         
00027         // Frame of camera
00028         RGBFrame FrameFromCam;
00029 
00030         //Initialize POB-Eye and LCD screen
00031         InitPOBEYE();
00032         InitLCD();
00033 
00034 
00035         // Init the graphic buffer : 128 per 64, 1 bytes per pixel and LCD_Buffer
00036         InitGraphicBuffer(&LCD_Screen,LCD_WIDTH,LCD_HEIGHT,EIGHT_BITS,LCD_Buffer);
00037 
00038         // Clear the graphic buffer
00039         ClearGraphicBuffer(&LCD_Screen);
00040         
00041         // Get the pointer of the red,green and blue video buffer
00042         GetPointerOnRGBFrame(&FrameFromCam);
00043 
00044         while (1)
00045         {
00046                 // Grab the RGB components
00047                 GrabRGBFrame();
00048                 
00049                 // Binary the RGB buffer
00050                 BinaryRGBFrame(&FrameFromCam);
00051 
00052                 // Put the pixel from the red component witch is binary, to the lcd buffer
00053                 for (k=0,i=63 ; i ; i--)
00054                 {
00055                         for (j=0;j<120;j++,k++)
00056                                         LCD_Screen.buffer[k] = FrameFromCam.red[i+(j*88)];
00057                         k+=8;
00058                 }
00059 
00060                 // draw the buffer on the screen
00061                 DrawLCD(&LCD_Screen);
00062         }
00063         return 0;
00064 }
